title: Copacabana Art Deco-ish geometric display sans
content:
Trying to come close to an old Copacabana font, looked at Bauhaus and Deco fonts, can’t find anything with this cool “C” shape. I know it’s out there; anything come to mind? Thanks.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185002im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/copa_3494.jpg)

 [‹ [ASK] Iron Man The Movie Fonts](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185002/http:/www.typophile.com/node/43241 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID: Henri Matisse Traits Essentiels typeface ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185002/http:/www.typophile.com/node/44853 "Go to next forum topic")
author: kayle

comments.content: Neutraface from House Industries. They heaviest is Bold, but I’m sure with some stroking it could easily be similar.
But you don’t want to stroke a quality typeface.

Actually, Neutraface’s heaviest Display weight is Titling, which is similar to what the requester is looking for.

David

<cite>But you don’t want to stroke a quality typeface.</cite>

Sometimes bad things have to happen to good fonts before you get to where you’re going.

Here it is set in Neutraface Display Titling...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080503185002im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/Copa_6451.gif)
